titleproper.value: Guide to the Rutherfurd Family Papers<lb/>1721-1879<lb/> <num>MS 532</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-07-05T21:09:09</date>

abstract.value: The Rutherfurd Family Papers is one of four discrete but closely related collections, known together as the Alexander-Stuyvesant-Rutherfurd Collections. The Rutherfurd Family Papers contain material created by or pertaining to members of the Rutherfurd and Alexander families of New York City and New Jersey, and the Reid family of New York City and Great Britain. The collection is arranged into series for each of the members of the respective families represented in the collection. The principal subseries within each of these series are: Correspondence; Legal Papers; Accounts, Bills, Receipts; and Surveys.

p.value: This collection should be cited as the Rutherfurd Family Papers, MS 532, The New-York Historical Society.
Valentine, Alan Chester. <emph render="italic">Lord Stirling</emph>. New York : Oxford University Press, 1969.

The collection supports research examining the business affairs of the propertied class in the late colonial and early republic periods, and relations within families whose members assumed opposing sides in the Revolution. There is very little material in the collection concerning specific political or military matters associated with the Revolution.

corpname.value: Great Britain. Army. Royal American Regiment (60th)

Series 1: John Rutherfurd1784-1846 and UndatedScope and Contents

Series I consists of the papers of John Rutherfurd (1760-1840).

Series 3 consist of papers of Mary Rutherfurd, who was the executrix of John Rutherfurd's will. The accounts, bills, and receipts appear to have been kept by her as a unit. It is sometimes unclear which of the items have to do with Mary Rutherfurd in her capacity as executrix, and which have to do with her in her own right. Therefore, all items having to do with her have been consolidated in this series.

Contents

Series 9 includes small amounts of correspondence, and legal papers from John Rutherfurd Jr. (1810-1871), Charlotte Rutherfurd, Lewis Morris Rutherfurd, and Sara Rutherfurd. It also includes cancelled checks from various members of the Rutherfurd family. These checks almost certainly relate to the estate of John Rutherfurd, and appear to have originally been kept together.

Rutherfurd -- Probate Document1852118Rutherfurd Family -- Cancelled Checks1839-Jan. 1840119Series 10: Other Persons1680-1879 and UndatedScope and Contents

This series consists of material not created by or pertaining to members of the Rutherfurd family. The series includes letters to Cadwallader Colden, regarding the boundary between New Jersey and New York; to Lemuel Cobb, mostly relating to surveys of lands in New York State; the London firm of Thomas Coults & Co., who corresponded with John Rutherfurd regarding the affairs of Susanna Robertson and William Jauncey; and James Morris, who received letters from John Rutherfurd and John Stark Robertson concerning their land holdings in New York State.

The series also includes accounts, bills, receipts, legal papers, and surveys of persons not related to the Rutherfurd family, and of unknown persons. For the most part, all such material is interfiled regardless of its original creator or possessor. Legal Papers and Accounts, Bills, Receipts are arranged chronologically. Surveys are arranged alphabetically by the surname of the owner of the tract surveyed.

David Provoost, because of the volume of material pertaining to him, is the only individual person in the series to be assigned a folder of Accounts, Bills, Receipts. Wills and inventories of estates are also foldered according to the names of the testators.

Note that two items from the Other Persons series are in Box 20. One is labelled Other Persons -- Accounts, Bills, Receipts -- Account Book of Unidentified Person. The other is labelled Surveys - A Record of Surveys of the Ramopock Tract in Bergen County in the Province of New-Jersey.

This series consists of papers relating to court cases adjudicated in New York and New Jersey in the 18th and 19th centuries. The cases are arranged alphabetically by the surname of the plaintiff. In those cases in which there was more than one plaintiff, the surname of the first named plaintiff is used. In two of the cases, members of the Rutherfurd family were defendants, and in one, John Stark Robertson appears to have been the defendant. Note that one item from this series, labelled Court papers -- Answer of Walter & CatherineRutherfurd -- Unidentified Suit is in Box 20, with other oversize material and volumes. For a list of the cases, consult the container list.

This series consists of assorted material having to do with or created on behalf of the Proprietors of the Eastern or Western Divisions of New Jersey.

The remaining series in the collection consist of small amounts of material having to do with specific institutions or geographical locations. Which family members (if any) these items pertain to, is not clear.
